title: Introduction
content:
Welcome to Practice Python Improve your python skills by understanding the topic and then solve some problem on the topic you just learn.
Python is worlds’s fastest growing and most popular programming language used by software engineers, SRE/DevOps, analysts, data scientists, and machine learning engineers alike.
Even nowdays System engineer requires programming skills, so this is best start if you are from the same background.

title: First Content
content: First content  if True: print("True")  # This is solution try it  success_msg("Great job!")  This is your hint 1 This is your hint 2

title: Overview
content:
Why should I learn Python? Python has been around for nearly 30 years and is still rising in popularity because of some “new” popular usage (Cloud, data science, machine learning…) and because Python is a really popular first language thanks to his accessibility and quick learning curve.
Remember language is just a tool and your skill will translate to any new language. It’s like learning to drive: once you know how to drive, you can drive any car, even if you don’t know where the buttons are, you’ll always be able to go somewhere with it.
How to Practice Python You’ve got to practice python in order only if you are not experience in Python. Each chapter assumes that you’ve practice the previous ones.
What’s in this Practice Python? Learning syntax of any programming language is not enough, you can learn many language but if you don’t develop problem solving skills then its all useless. That’s why this practice/course is combination of data structure and algorithms with Python 3. So if you don’t know anything about any programming language then you can start from Beginning.
